Class HTMLCleaner

  • java.lang.Object
    • HTMLCleaner

  • public class HTMLCleaner
extends Object
    A helper class with several static methods that will help fetch a webpage, strip out all of the HTML, and parse the resulting plain text into words. Meant to be used for the web crawler project.
    See Also:
    HTMLCleaner, HTMLCleanerTest

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      HTMLCleaner() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static String cleanHTML(String html)
      Removes all style and script tags (and any text in between those tags), all HTML tags, and all special characters/entities.
      static String fetchHTML(String url)
      Fetches the webpage at the provided URL by opening a socket, sending an HTTP request, removing the headers, and returning the resulting HTML code.
      static ArrayList<String> fetchWords(String url)
      Fetches the webpage at the provided URL, cleans up the HTML tags, and parses the resulting plain text into words.
      static ArrayList<String> parseWords(String text)
      Parses the provided plain text (already cleaned of HTML tags) into individual words.
      static String stripElement(String name, String html)
      Removes everything between the element tags, and the element tags themselves.
      static String stripEntities(String html)
      Replaces all HTML entities in the text with a space.
      static String stripTags(String html)
      Removes all HTML tags, which is essentially anything between the < and > symbols.

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • fetchWords

        public static ArrayList<String> fetchWords(String url)
        Fetches the webpage at the provided URL, cleans up the HTML tags, and parses the resulting plain text into words. THIS METHOD IS PROVIDED FOR YOU. DO NOT MODIFY.
        Parameters:
        url - - webpage to download
        Returns:
        list of parsed words

      • parseWords

        public static ArrayList<String> parseWords(String text)
        Parses the provided plain text (already cleaned of HTML tags) into individual words. THIS METHOD IS PROVIDED FOR YOU. DO NOT MODIFY.
        Parameters:
        text - - plain text without html tags
        Returns:
        list of parsed words

      • cleanHTML

        public static String cleanHTML(String html)
        Removes all style and script tags (and any text in between those tags), all HTML tags, and all special characters/entities. THIS METHOD IS PROVIDED FOR YOU. DO NOT MODIFY.
        Parameters:
        html - - html code to parse
        Returns:
        plain text

      • fetchHTML

        public static String fetchHTML(String url)
        Fetches the webpage at the provided URL by opening a socket, sending an HTTP request, removing the headers, and returning the resulting HTML code. You can use the HTMLFetcher class, but you must include all required classes with your homework. Please note this method should not throw any exceptions.
        Parameters:
        url - - webpage to download
        Returns:
        html code

      • stripElement

        public static String stripElement(String name,
                                  String html)
        Removes everything between the element tags, and the element tags themselves. For example, consider the html code: 
         <style type="text/css">body { font-size: 10pt; }</style>
        If removing the "style" element, all of the above code will be removed, and replaced with the empty string.
        Parameters:
        name - - name of the element to strip, like style or script
        html - - html code to parse
        Returns:
        html code without the element specified

      • stripTags

        public static String stripTags(String html)
        Removes all HTML tags, which is essentially anything between the < and > symbols. The tag will be replaced by the empty string.
        Parameters:
        html - - html code to parse
        Returns:
        text without any html tags

      • stripEntities

        public static String stripEntities(String html)
        Replaces all HTML entities in the text with a space. For example, "2010–2012" will become "2010 2012".
        Parameters:
        html - - the text with html code being checked
        Returns:
        text with HTML entities replaced by a space
